physical_examinations.vital_signs: Serum creatinine: 2.3 mg/dl (lowest measured 2 months after transplantation)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The first allograft biopsy at 4 months showed normal glomerular and vascular pattern with mild interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy; serum creatinine was 3.3 mg/dl.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's kidney function worsened over time, with further allograft dysfunction leading to the restart of hemodialysis 9 months after transplantation.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Anuria persisted for 3 weeks and thereafter diuresis increased to 1000 ml/d but remained dialysis-dependent.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Three allograft biopsies taken revealed normal glomerular pattern, no signs of rejection, but extensive acute tubular injury and obstruction by needle-shaped crystals.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Kidney function did not improve despite treatment; the patient remained dialysis-dependent 11 months after starting allopurinol treatment.
